intro: Durandea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf durandea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular. Its flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale pink, with four petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
